subject: Data
title: The Missing Denominator Trick
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Missing Denominator Trick.

hook.text: '1,000 people were injured by vending machines last year!' Scary.

buildup.text: The missing denominator trick presents a numerator â€” the count â€” without the base that gives it meaning.

discovery.text: Without context, any number can sound alarming. '50,000 bridge accidents' means nothing without total crossings.

twist.text: News headlines exploit this constantly. 'Deaths from X rose by 200!' Often that's from 3 to 9.

climax.text: Always demand the denominator. Without it, a statistic is designed to trigger emotion, not understanding.

punchline.text: A number without context is just a scare tactic.

quiz.question: What is the 'missing denominator' trick?
options: Presenting a count without the base that gives it context
